verbose_text: The fatty acid desaturation (FAD) enzymes, FAD2 (Delta12 desaturase) and FAD3 (Delta15 desaturase), along with FAD6 and FAD7 / FAD8, are responsible for sequential modification of oleic acid to linoleic acid and linolenic acid, thereby increasing the polyunsaturated to saturated (P : S) fatty acid ratios.
evidence: FAD2 (Delta12 desaturase) and FAD3 (Delta15 desaturase), along with FAD6 and FAD7/FAD8, are responsible for sequential modification of oleic acid to linoleic acid and linolenic acid, thereby increasing the polyunsaturated to saturated (P:S) fatty acid
